Those little white flowers, what do they actually do?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): FAQ: The Most Important Game Data: Those little white flowers, what do they actually do?
By Dark Phoenix on Friday, March 2, 2001 - 02:23 am:

Ever wonder what those little white flowers do, besides take up space in your inventory? Some of you may have heard rumours that they relieve stress if held in the inventory. Well, guess what?

They're true!

The question now is, "How much stress does it cure, and how much would it help my monster?"

The answer is, unfortunately, not much.

The flowers relieve stress in much the same manner as a Gemini Pot, only not as effective. The effects are determined at the beginning of each month, before you are asked to feed your monster . The amount of stress relieved depends on the monsters stress level at that time.

0-49 stress = no effect
50 - 99 stress = -1 to Stress
100 stress = -2 to Stress

Are the effects of the flowers culmulative?

Yes, but as with the Gemini Pots, there is a catch. The effect of each additional flower is determined in succession, not all to once. To explain it better, here in example:

Say the rancher has 10 flowers in his/her inventory at the beginning of the month and his/her monster's stress is at 52. After the effects of the flowers are determined, the monster will have a stress of 49.

Only 49? Why? Because the effect of each flower is determined one at a time, not all to once.

1st flower: 52 Stress, -1 Stress
2nd flower: 51 Stress, -1 Stress
3rd flower: 50 Stress, -1 Stress
4th flower: 49 Stress, no effect
5th flower: 49 Stress, no effect
6th flower: 49 Stress, no effect
7th flower: 49 Stress, no effect
8th flower: 49 Stress, no effect
9th flower: 49 Stress, no effect
10th flower: 49 Stress, no effect

Get the picture?

My conclusions: Since the monster is already well into the realm of lifespan loss before the flowers kick in, and by their nature CANNOT take the stress down out of the danger zone, my conclusion is that they, like the Gemini Pots, are worthless. Keep 'em if you want, but I suggest selling them to make room in your inventory.

By Tony on Friday, March 2, 2001 - 04:08 am:

By torey_luvullo on Friday, March 2, 2001 - 05:46 am:

one more question. my jilt asks for them, about twice a month. if i give it to her, do i get a -1 stress on the spot? or do they only have an effect if held in inventory?

By Dark Phoenix on Friday, March 2, 2001 - 07:02 am:

The flowers you give to her will drop her stress by 1.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Friday, March 2, 2001 - 03:41 pm:

Hey, great work, DP! My compliments to the coder! Well, wasn't as helpful as I might have hoped, but at least we know what they do, now. And you have to admit: for something that your monster just happens to bring you, it at least does _something_ in your inventory.
